description: n = (sum of digits of n)^(number of digits of n).
comments: Subset of A023106. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 20 2008
example: n=512 is in the sequence because (5 + 1 + 2)^3 = 512.
author: _Felice Russo_
extensions: To prove completeness, consider that k^m contains more than m digits for every k >= 10 and check 1<=k<=9 explicitly. - Ulrich Schimke (ulrschimke(AT)aol.com)
